item.title: The Old, Innovative Nokia Is Back
item.description:
The Old, Innovative Nokia Is Back

Soon after Microsoft wrote off the entire value of the handset business it had acquired from Nokia, the Finnish company is unexpectedly back with an innovative consumer product. Nokia Ozo, a sphere with camera lenses protruding from it, is refreshingly out of left field.

item.title: A Visual Introduction to Machine Learning
item.description:
A Visual Introduction to Machine Learning

Let's revisit the 73-ft elevation boundary proposed previously to see how we can improve upon our intuition. Clearly, this requires a different perspective. By transforming our visualizaion into a histogram, we can better see how frequently homes appear at each elevation.

item.title: Golden Record: Sounds of Earth by NASA
item.description:
Golden Record: Sounds of Earth by NASA

Here's a collection of NASA sounds from historic spaceflights and current missions. You can hear the roar of a space shuttle launch or Neil Armstrong's "One small step for (a) man, one giant leap for

item.title: Flux Architecture Visual Cheatsheet
item.description:
Flux Architecture Visual Cheatsheet

At hashtagify.me we recently started experimenting with the React library, and, right from the start, I really liked what I saw. After that, I also went to study the Flux architecture, and, honestly, I found the official overview and tutorials rather confusing.

item.title: How Google Translate squeezes deep learning onto a phone
item.description:
How Google Translate squeezes deep learning onto a phone

Today we announced that the Google Translate app now does real-time visual translation of 20 more languages. So the next time you're in Prague and can't read a menu, we've got your back. But how are we able to recognize these new languages? In short: deep neural nets.

item.title: Nokia reveals Ozo, a futuristic new camera for filming virtual reality
item.description:
Nokia reveals Ozo, a futuristic new camera for filming virtual reality

Designed for Hollywood, not consumers Microsoft bought Nokia's handset business in 2013, two big questions hovered above all. The first was "why," and we never got a convincing answer: Microsoft wrote off $7.6 billion in Nokia costs this month, higher than the purchase price.

item.title: Flock 1e Deployment- July 13, 2015
item.description:
Flock 1e Deployment- July 13, 2015

Flock 1e is deployed from a Nanroacks deployer on the Kibo Experimental Wing of the International Space Station. Video Courtesy of NASA. Read more about the deployments: https://www.planet.com/pulse/flock1e/

item.title: Can you fit your Life into a Backpack? - Nomad List - Stories
item.description:
Can you fit your Life into a Backpack? - Nomad List - Stories

I've recently started to reduce my personal belongings to just a handful of things that fit into a backpack. I wanted to share the motivation behind it and the things I decided to keep. I'm not fully there yet but the journey is quite amazing so far.

item.title: Gawker gives media world a model of crude courage
item.description:
Gawker gives media world a model of crude courage
